meanings.definition: A person who complains or grumbles.
meanings.sent1: The moner in our class always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: My brother is such a moner when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: The moner at the restaurant kept sending his food back, claiming it was too cold.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the office moner, always dissatisfied with her workload.
meanings.sent5: The old man in the park was a legendary moner, never happy with the weather.

meanings.sent1: I wish my sister wouldn't moner about doing her chores all the time.
meanings.sent2: The customer began to moner about the slow service at the store.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to moner at me for not giving it enough treats.
meanings.sent4: The engine started to moner loudly, indicating a problem.
meanings.sent5: The child continued to moner about wanting a toy until his parents finally bought it for him.
